page.title: 20 THE ROYAL EARLSWOOD
page.content: {The Royal Earlswood}is where mentally handicapped people go .It cost{Â£29000}to build and was opened in {1864}.Prince Albert laid the foundation stone .In{1948}it was taken over by the NHS . One of the old farm buildings was turned into a swimming pool which is warm and shallow . It cost{Â£5m}to run every year -each week it costs{Â£194.89}to look after each patient . The words{mentally handicapped}are sometimes confused with{mental illness - mental illness can strike anyone at any age . It usually responds to treatment and can often be cured .To be mentally handicapped is to have an illness where the brain does not grow properly .It cannot usually be cured .
